children.subject: Good question! If you apply for a TA/ASE position, you will not be penalized for taking a P/NP option. We may ask you to report your shadow grade (i.e. you or we can ask the instructor for your actual grade) if you're comfortable sharing that. If you don’t, you may be subjected to a more rigorous interview where we make sure you know the material, but as long as you can pass that, you'll be fine. Bottom line, yes take P/NP if you prefer that; it will not negatively affect your chances of being on staff. :)
Given this semester's grading options, would we still be considered for the reader/tutor positions if we took the course P/NP?
Is there a similar Google form for EECS 16B if we're interested in joining course staff?
Yes, we're not finished hiring yet; anybody who filled out the interest form should be receiving a supplemental reader/tutor application from course staff in the near future.
Bump, is the hiring process still ongoing? Especially for readers

history.content:
Hi everybody:

Applications for EECS 16A course staff for the Fall 2020 semester are now available! We have a variety of roles available, and all positions are paid. 

Anyone who has taken the course is invited to apply for Reader and Group Tutor positions; both readers and tutors are considered Academic Student Employees (ASEs). Readers will be responsible for grading homework and debugging exams, and tutors may assist in lab sections, office hours, or homework parties.

If you have prior experience teaching 16A or TAing another course and would like to apply for a TA position, please also fill out the two forms linked above and mark your interest in becoming a TA.

Anyone interested in joining course staff should fill out the interest form here by Friday, 5/1 at 11:59 p.m. in addition to the department application form found here. 

If you have any specific questions about being on course staff, feel free to post a follow-up discussion below!
